free_text.Learning outcomes: To introduce the principles governing the interactions between light and biological tissue, and more specifically, the role of light activated molecules in biology and medicine.[br/]To describe the relevant spectral, photochemical and photobiological concepts used in this field.[br/]To enable the student to communicate and interact directly with scientists as well as medical researchers in this field.[br/]Besides obtaining a solid knowledge of the basic principles of photobiology and photomedicine, the student will also become familiar with the instrumentation used in this area. [br/]The most important applications of the basic photobiological principles in the life sciences and in medicine will be described. Finally, industrial applications and developments will be presented.
